result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI 6th and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI 6th and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Patrick J. Kraemer was found guilty of OWI 6th, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant receives credit for any administrative suspension.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.  Defendant's bond has been applied towards the fine and costs.

Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall maintain employment at agent's discretion.  Defendant shall attend the victim impact panel either in October or December of this year.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
Jail sentence shall begin immediately. The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Patrick J. Kraemer in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No factual corrections to the PSI.  Argument by counsel regarding sentencing.  No statement by defendant.  Court orders withheld sentence probation 3 years  with conditions of 10 months county jail with huber to begin immediately; $3,214.00 fine; AODA; DNA sample and surcharge; 24 month revocation of DL; IID; $41.00 blood draw; VIP; absolute sobriety; maintain employment at agent's discretion; 2 days sentence credit.  - rt
Days Credit Worksheet
Sentencing hearing on October 3, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Patrick J. Kraemer in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tlusty states agreement on the record.  DE enters a plea of no contest to the charge of OWI-6th.  Plea colloquy.    Factual basis exists. Court finds plea given freely, voluntarily and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty of count one; count two dismissed.  Court orders Pre-Sentence Investigation. of Representation
Adjourned initial appearance at 09-22-2015 08:30 am

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Arrest Report
Initial Appearance on September 8, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick J. Kraemer appears in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $2,000.00 cash bond; booking; no alcohol possession or consumption; no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Next court date is September 8, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
